title: Roy Tang
description: Roy Tang's blog. Programmer, engineer, scientist, critic, gamer, dreamer, and kid-at-heart. Randomly amazed.

items.content_html: You know, when I said I wanted the real world to be more like Harry Potter I just meant the teleportation and the magic stuff, not the entire plot of book 5 where the government refuses to do anything about a deadly threat so the teenagers have to rise up and fight back.

items.content_html: I was just sat here wondering why no-one gets killed on Eternia with a gun. Then I realised it’s mainly down to there being no guns on the planet. Almost like there’s a DIRECT FUCKING CORRELATION BETWEEN THE TWO.

items.content_html:
It‚Äôs a well-known phenomenon that researchers spend more time studying Twitter and less time studying Facebook than would seem to be reasonable.

The reason: Twitter‚Äôs more-open API is a lot easier to work with than FB is. (1/x)
items.summary:

items.content_html:
It’s interesting to read about the details of Mueller’s Russian indictments. It gives a pretty good picture of how Russia was able to weaponize the internet and social media by preying on things like human ignorance and filter bubbles to effectively divide a nation.

This is the modern face of information warfare, and Russia is leading the way. I’m curious as to if and how society will adjust and push back against these trends

(It’s actually surprising that in the latest @CivGame expansion they don’t have a Spy mission to reduce loyalty in an enemy city).
items.summary:
It’s interesting to read about the details of Mueller’s Russian indictments. It gives a pretty good picture of how Russia was able to weaponize the internet and social media by preying on things like human ignorance and filter bubbles to effectively divide a nation.
This is the modern face of information warfare, and Russia is leading the way. I’m curious as to if and how society will adjust and push back against these trends
